name: stumblingly
content:
stumblingly adverb
(WALKING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of walking) in a way that is awkward or not controlled: The two men swayed stumblingly about. I groped my way stumblingly out of the dark room.
More examplesFewer examplesHe ran stumblingly towards the first aid tent.

stumblingly adverb
(WITH MISTAKES)
(of speech) in a way that involves mistakes, such as repeating something or pausing too long: The youngster stumblingly explained what they had been laughing about. He stumblingly told her it was over between them.
with difficulty, or involving repeated problems or mistakes: They were very slowly and stumblingly making progress. He ran a stumblingly weak campaign.
More examplesFewer examplesThe commentary was often stumblingly delivered.
